lead_paragraph: Michael Phelps won two titles yesterday at the national swimming championships and barely missed a world record in the 200-meter backstroke.Phelps, who scheduled an ambitious 10-event program at the Indiana University Natatorium, failed to qualify for the final of the 200 breaststroke. But he won the 200 backstroke in 1 minute 54.65 seconds, just .33 seconds off the world record of 1:54.32 set by Ryan Lochte at the world championships in March. He later helped Michigan win the 4x100-freestyle relay.Dana Torres, a 40-year-old mother trying to qualify for her fifth Olympics, won the 100 women’s freestyle in 54.45 seconds, beating Amanda Weir. David Walters won the men’s 100 freestyle in 48.96 seconds.
